crepe_demo.title: Crepe Editor Performance Sandbox
crepe_demo.intro: Use the selector below to gradually approach the production note editor. Watch which step introduces lag to pinpoint the bottleneck.
crepe_demo.base_markdown:
# Crepe Minimal Demo

Try typing, selecting, and dragging text here to inspect the editor core.

## Notes
- No auto save
- No note references, Slash menu, or business extensions
- Focus on Milkdown/Crepe interaction performance only

bare.label: Step 1: Vanilla Crepe
bare.description: Run Crepe with its official defaults to benchmark the editor core.

listener.label: Step 2: Add listener
listener.description: Enable the Milkdown listener plugin to mimic onChange hooks and state syncing.

notes-css.label: Step 3: Apply note styles
notes-css.description: Load the note page fonts and CSS while keeping the listener to test styling impact.

notes-css-events.label: Step 4: Bind keyboard events
notes-css-events.description: Attach keydown/input/composition listeners and count triggers to measure DOM event overhead.

milkdown-core.label: Step 5: Mount Milkdown core
milkdown-core.description: Switch to MilkdownMarkdownEditor with only the rendering core, disabling listener, DOM events, and business extensions.

milkdown-dom.label: Step 6: Enable DOM sync
milkdown-dom.description: Turn on the listener and DOM synchronization while keeping Mentions, Slash, and mistake reference plugins disabled.

milkdown-extensions.label: Step 7: Load Mentions/Slash
milkdown-extensions.description: Enable Mentions and Slash commands while keeping mistake reference and AI preview extensions disabled.

full-notes-editor.label: Step 8: Full note editor
full-notes-editor.description: Mount the production note editor with Mentions, Slash, mistake references, AI preview, and all business events for comparison.

complete_flow.name: Complete Flow Test
complete_flow.description: Test complete chat flow from homepage: multi-turn→edit→save→continue→delete→verify (requires Playwright or manual coordination)

delete.name: Delete Message Save
delete.description: Test if deleting a chat message saves correctly to database

stream_complete.name: Stream Complete Save
stream_complete.description: Test if stream completion auto-saves correctly

manual_stop.name: Manual Stop Save
manual_stop.description: Test if manually stopping stream saves correctly

edit_resend.name: Edit Resend Save
edit_resend.description: Test if editing and resending message saves correctly

manual_save.name: Manual Trigger Save
manual_save.description: Test if manual save button works correctly

instructions.step1: Open a mistake detail page with multiple messages
instructions.step4: Observe test steps execution and final results

backendTest.title: Backend API Test (Unified Flow)
backendTest.runInDesktop: Please run this page in the Tauri desktop app
backendTest.tauriUnavailable: Tauri environment unavailable, please run in the desktop app

input.label: Mistake ID
input.placeholder: Enter a mistake ID (e.g., d6b9...) to load its stored chats

layers.title: Multi-layer history snapshot (current page)
layers.hint: Note: These columns represent, respectively, the DB-projected chat history, CompatRuntime.store projection, UniversalAppChatHost chatHistory, and the final visibleChatHistory passed to VirtualizedChatList. They help locate which layer starts dropping messages.
layers.diagnostic_unknown: Diagnostic: Host snapshots are not available yet, unable to automatically determine where the divergence starts.
layers.diagnostic_runtime: Diagnostic: Message count diverges from the DB projection at the Runtime.store layer (DB={{db}}, Runtime={{runtime}}). Downstream layers inherit this, so focus on CompatRuntime.loadHistory and RuntimeStore.apply.
layers.diagnostic_host: Diagnostic: Runtime.store matches the DB projection, but the host chatHistory count differs (DB={{db}}, Host={{host}}). Check additional overrides/filters inside UniversalAppChatHost.
layers.diagnostic_visible: Diagnostic: Both Runtime.store and host chatHistory match the DB projection, but visibleHistory differs (DB={{db}}, Visible={{visible}}). Check filters or indexing logic in VirtualizedChatList/MessageWithThinking.
layers.diagnostic_ok: Diagnostic: All four layers match the DB-projected message count. If the UI still looks incorrect, compare role sequences and stableIds between layers.

empty.state: No mistake loaded yet. Enter an ID above to inspect stored chats.
empty.messages: This mistake has no chat messages.

error.missing_id: Please enter a mistake ID first
error.not_found: Cannot find a mistake with ID {{id}}
